Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[msbuild] Now JavaDoc task takes reference jars, and relevant tasks d…" (#1687) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
…on't break.

Those changes were required to make it pass for building new androidx
libraries (but not limited to them).
Without references as in `javadoc -cp` they fail to resolve references.

It's okay, but JavaToolTask picks up all those messages as errors, and
the error code is respected and thus the entire binding library build fails.

That's not what we want. We should skip those failures and go on.

The subsequent crash at javadoc-to-mdoc failure needs investigation, but
it shouldn't block binding builds either.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Mono.Debugger hangs Visual Studio 2017 for ~3min on the "Starting Android application" step" (#1664) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Build a Xamarin.Android project
2.  Run a Xamarin.Android project

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
The app should be deployed to the device and run.

### Actual Behavior
VS hangs for ~3 min, the a message pops up, saying _Mono Debugging for Visual Studio 4.10.5 likely caused 194 seconds  of unresponsiveness. _ Only after, does the app get deployed.

Events.RelatedBody:
A follow up to 9178d614ae881862623ca07b71c16fab8b164cdb, add `DISABLE_IOS=1`
to a handful more locations so that Mono can be built without Xcode installed
on the system.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error CS0012 when building against v3" (#2564) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Upgrading MvvmCross to v3 of XF we ran into issue where we're seeing the following error. 
error CS0012: The type 'Object' is defined in an assembly that is not referenced. You must add a reference to assembly 'netstandard, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=cc7b13ffcd2ddd51'.
MvvmCross is multi-targeted and I suspect that this is related to when it's building the Android target

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Grab the branch of MvvmCross referenced in this PR https://github.com/MvvmCross/MvvmCross/pull/2831

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Android] Xamarin: Cannot access a disposed object." (#2406) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi everybody. I am having a problem in my production app that is the exception below. The problem makes the app stops, but I've never reproduced it in my development environment. Some ideias of how I could solve it? I read it could be some xamarin issue, but I really need some way to correct this.

Any help would be apreciated. Thanks folks!

System.ObjectDisposedException: Cannot access a disposed object.
Object name: 'Android.Widget.EditText'.
  at Java.Interop.JniPeerMembers.AssertSelf (Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable self) [0x00029] in <c7147c8e4d504ca89af706ea53f4f899>:0 
  at Java.Interop.JniPeerMembers+JniInstanceMethods.InvokeNonvirtualVoidMethod (System.String encodedMember, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable self, Java.Interop.JniArgumentValue* parameters) [0x00000] in <c7147c8e4d504ca89af706ea53f4f899>:0

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Android] Renderers associated with ListViews are sometimes not being disposed of which causes left over events to throw exceptions" (#2829) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
A number of issues have popped up related to the renderers of a ListView not all correctly disposing. The use cases are generally the same
- Setup list view for recycling
- Navigate to a page with the listview
- scroll some
- pop the page off
- do this over and over again and at some point an exception will occur related to dispose

This issue is meant to be the root issue for the set of issues people have logged for this problem.

My current theory on this goes as follows 

In certain cases when you scroll a list view and it creates a new view using view recycling this would cause a view to become non visible but still exist in memory.

Because of this when iterating with GetChildAt you would be returned NULL for a given position because that view isn't visible though it and its resources still exist in memory. 

What this means is that DisposeCells now will not be able to access said View 

```C#
void DisposeCells()
		{
			var cellCount = _realListView?.ChildCount ?? 0;
			for (int i = 0; i < cellCount; i++)
			{
				var layout = _realListView.GetChildAt(i) as ConditionalFocusLayout;

				// Headers and footers will be skipped. They are disposed elsewhere.
				if (layout == null || layout.IsDisposed())
					continue;
```




### Steps to Reproduce

https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/2746
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/2004
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/2421
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/2406

### Expected Behavior
All created views should be disposed of

### Actual Behavior
Occasionally a non visible view is not recycled

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0
- Last known good version: unknown
